description:
## Welcome
Welcome to the RML basic tutorial! During the following chapters you will learn all the knowledge you need to write your own RML mappings. The first step is to know the basic syntax/vocabulary.
## Theory
An RML mapping is composed of at least one element called **"TriplesMap"**. This element is written as **<#label>** where label is the name given to each element.

A **"TripleMap"** must have two different properties: ***rml:logicalSource*** and ***rr:subjectMap***. The first is used to declare the data source and the second is used to define the subject of the RDF triples.
 - The ***rml:logicalSource*** property must be defined by speciying where the data is and its format with the ***rml:source*** and ***rml:referenceFormulation*** predicates respectively. Since learning the logicalSource is not the main purpose of this tutorial, it is provided down below.
######
    <#TriplesMap1> rml:logicalSource [ 
     	  rml:source "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/helio-ecosystem/helio-ecosystem/main/resources/mappings-data/ldac/people.csv";
     	  rml:referenceFormulation ql:CSV
	];

 - The ***rr:subjectMap*** define the subject of the RDF triples. For speciying the subject it has to be used the property ***rr:template*** to define the IRI, this must contain a static part and a dynamic part that points to a column of our data (in this case is a column since we have a CSV). ***For instance "http://sample.com/example/user/{ID}".*** This property must be with **rr:termType rr:IRI** triplet. Finally, the ***rdf:type*** is specifyed using the property ***rr:class*** and indicating in its range the class itself.
## Hands-on
### Task
Finish the mapping below to generate subjects with a URI that starts with "http://sample.com/resource/" and their identifiers are P followed by the ID data. Moreover, the subject class is foaf:Person.
### CSV file content
| ID | Name | Phone | City |
|--|--|--|--|

| 2 | "Chadd Sporer" | +1-352-334-0992 | Iowa |
